name: wlklnwwlklnupgr2
params: setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wi(wcel(c0, cupgr), wi(wcel(c1, co(c2, cwwlksn, c0)), wex(s0, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), c1), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c2)))))

stmt.origin: wlklnwwlkln2lem(s0, c1, c2, c0, wcel(c0, cupgr))
stmt.pretty: wlklnwwlkln2lem(s0, c1, c2, c0, c0 ∈ UPGraph)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cupgr), wi(wcel(c1, co(c2, cwwlksn, c0)), wex(s0, wa(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), c1), wceq(cfv(chash, cv(s0)), c2)))))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cupgr), wi(wcel(c1, cfv(cwwlks, c0)), wex(s0, wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cwlks, c0), c1))))
-| diffsc(s0, c1)
-| diffsc(s0, c2)
-| diffsc(s0, c0)
-| diffsw(s0, wcel(c0, cupgr))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ UPGraph →(c1 ∈(c2[WWalksN]c0)→ ∃(s0,(s0[(Walks ` c0)]c1 ∧(# ` s0)= c2))))
⊣ (c0 ∈ UPGraph →(c1 ∈(WWalks ` c0)→ ∃(s0, s0[(Walks ` c0)]c1)))
⊣ d(s0, c1)
⊣ d(s0, c2)
⊣ d(s0, c0)
⊣ d(s0, c0 ∈ UPGraph)

comment: A walk of length ` N ` as word corresponds to the sequence of vertices in a walk of length ` N ` in a pseudograph. This variant of ~ wlklnwwlkln2 does not require ` G ` to be a simple pseudograph, but it requires (indirectly) the Axiom of Choice. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 21-Jul-2018.) (Revised by AV, 12-Apr-2021.)
